SERVICIO DEPLORABLE

Dos apartados positivos:

El segundo, el ciudadano onubense entender√° la extrema urgencia de blindar los servicios p√∫blicos de salud, as√≠ como la importancia de un gobierno que persiga dar protagonismo a la Seguridad Social.

(Translated by Google)
DEPLORABLE SERVICE

It is fine for a minor consultation (common cold, blood tests, or the like), but for things of greater significance, it highlights the lack of personnel and organization of the same.

You do not have to be a star to think that they are looking to bill, which is why they keep patients hospitalized days and days and days without testing and with negligible doctor passes of between one and four minutes maximum duration (you have to riddle questions if you are interested in knowing the patient's clinic).

There is no improvement with respect to public service (rather the other way around) so the mere existence of the Costa de La Luz Hospital is meaningless.

Two positive sections:

The first, the rooms are private, large, clean and with a sofa bed for the companions.

The second, the Huelva citizen will understand the extreme urgency of shielding public health services, as well as the importance of a government that seeks to give prominence to Social Security.

11/11/2020
Visit for endoscopy on the first floor of the Hospital Sagrado Coraz√≥n, entrance by Viladomat street in Barcelona. Visiting time: 11:30 am
Arrival time: 11:15

Test duration (counting about 10 minutes in which they left me sitting because I was dizzy) 29 minutes.
Situation within the consultation: I was punctured for anesthesia by the same nurse who came to collect the papers of all the patients who were waiting in a crowded corridor. He does this without changing gloves and without putting gel on his hands. On the stretcher there is a used and wrinkled sheet, without any paper covering and they make me lie on my side, with my street clothes and my boots on, without a paper gown or booties. Without picking up my hair or any hygiene measure, just as I come from the street, without a jacket. On the next gurney, without any screen to give a little privacy, an elderly woman who was undergoing a colonoscopy, embarrassed and continually apologizing for extracting the air that had been breathed into her for the test, which she tried to reassure telling him that I know what this test is and not to be bothered by the noises. Estoy haciendo todo lo posible para cambiar de centro lo antes posible. Desde que forma parte del grupo Quir√≥n, es un aut√©ntico caos. De hecho tuve que cambiarme a este centro cuando todav√≠a no era del grupo porque en Quir√≥n Dexeus (donde sol√≠a visitarme) ocurr√≠an situaciones similares.

Desaconsejo absolutamente este centro y en general todo lo que se apellide Quir√≥n. No pongo en duda la profesionalidad de los doctores (siempre he tenido excelente experiencia con los doctores) pero la gesti√≥n es absolutamente desastrosa y totalmente irrespetuosa hacia el paciente.

When you finally get the appointment, good luck waiting on the day of the visit. I absolutely discourage this center and in general everything that is called Chiron. I do not question the professionalism of the doctors (I have always had excellent experience with the doctors) but the management is absolutely disastrous and totally disrespectful towards the patient.

It does not make any sense. They said that we would take her the next day and that the results would be in 3 ... 4 days no matter how much the doctor asked for it to be done urgently. A shame at the time of Covid, because with its results we could have detected a urinary infection and not have done a swab for covid since the patient had a fever.

Consultations: In all the occasions that have been several, I had problems with the citations. You arrive at the plant and the machine does not work. Return to reception to wait for 20 numbers, and back to the floor. The system works fatal. Also, if the code they give you (machines or reception) is to protect privacy, why then does someone leave the staff shouting your name ?????
Signaling: Poor and insufficient. The hospital is very large, if you have a London street consultation, an x-ray and an analysis, you spend half a day wandering the hospital, without anyone informing you.
Access: On the Paris street there is no ramp or elevator. It is mandatory to eliminate architectural barriers.
Parking: Excessively expensive. For a consultation and a diagnostic test, I had to pay 8.70 euros. One day from 3pm to 11pm, 30 euros. In addition to the deplorable state in which it is located and the poor signaling to access consultations or hospitalization.
Hospitalization: I was twice on the fifth floor and once on the sixth. The nursing staff is very friendly, but there is a lack of communication between doctors and staff. And don't ask for an extra pillow or a blanket because they don't have one.
The sixth floor is quite modernized, but the fifth seems from before the war (especially the bathroom). In the year 2020 can there still be similar rooms?
Emergencies: The attention, in order not to have patients waiting and a lot of staff in the control, was slow. I leave it that way.
TV: It is paid and do not accept cards, so the first days of my stay I could not use it.
The patient care staff does not work from Friday afternoon to Monday, with which three days without service. Because nobody, absolutely nobody can solve it.
And I could keep mentioning many more problems (one month to get an invoice, when it's supposed to be all computerized) .....

(Translated by Google) Until a little over a year ago, I would have given it 4 stars. Today I give it three that it leans towards two ...
Positive points:
- Large number of specialties and equipment
- Quick to do lab studies, images, etc., and the results are received by email
- Good building condition and modern equipment
- The treatment, both from doctors and nurses and the counter, is generally good
Neutral points:
- Middle-aged doctors, which offers experience without being outdated in the treatments, although some doctors are SO young that you think they were received yesterday and when they see you they seem to have no idea what is affecting you , causing distrust on the part of the patient towards the doctor (it has happened to me on several occasions)
- Very well equipped physiotherapy room but with VERY few therapists for the number of patients (and most are students), which makes one feel a bit "abandoned" inside the rehabilitation room.
Bad points:
- On MANY occasions, the wait to be seen is long. And when I say long I mean, sometimes, more than 1 hour (a few weeks ago I waited more than 2 hours ...). This is bad at any time, but in these Covid times, being locked in a waiting room with lots of other people waiting for so long is FAR from being acceptable. They must do something URGENT in this regard!
- Appointments until one or two years ago were easy, rarely had to wait more than 2 weeks to be seen by the doctor. Today you rarely get an appointment in less than 3 weeks (I would say a month). It's looking a lot like Social Security in this regard. One pays additional to be able to be seen sooner.
- The Dental Unit no longer serves with Mutual

(Original)
Hasta hace poco m√°s de un a√±o, le hubiese dado 4 estrellas. Hoy en d√≠a le doy tres que se inclina hacia dos...
Puntos positivos:
- Gran cantidad de especialidades y equipamiento
- R√°pido para hacer estudios de laboratorio, im√°genes, etc., y los resultados se reciben por correo electr√≥nico
- Buen estado edilicio y equipamiento moderno
- El trato, tanto de los m√©dicos como de los enfermeros y el mostrador, generalmente es bueno
Puntos neutros:
- M√©dicos de mediana edad, lo que ofrece experiencia sin estar anticuados en los tratamientos, aunque algunos m√©dicos son TAN j√≥venes que uno piensa que se recibieron ayer y cuando te ven parece que no tienen ni idea de qu√© es lo que le est√° afectando a uno, provocando desconfianza por parte del paciente hacia el m√©dico (me ha pasado en varias oportunidades)
- Sala de fisioterapia muy bien equipada pero con MUY pocos terapeutas para la cantidad de pacientes (y la mayor√≠a son estudiantes), lo que hace que uno se sienta un poco "abandonado" dentro de la sala de rehabilitaci√≥n.
Puntos negativos:
- En MUCHAS ocasiones, la espera para ser atendido es larga. Y cuando digo larga me refiero a, en ocasiones, m√°s de 1 hora (hace unas semanas esper√© m√°s de 2 horas....). Esto es malo en cualquier momento, pero en estos tiempos de Covid, estar encerrados en una sala de espera con mucha otra gente esperando durante tanto tiempo LEJOS est√° de ser aceptable. ¬°Deben hacer algo URGENTE en este sentido!
- Las citas hasta hace uno o dos a√±os se consegu√≠an f√°cil, rara vez hab√≠a que esperar m√°s de 2 semanas para ser visto por el m√©dico. Hoy en d√≠a rara vez se consigue cita en menos de 3 semanas (dir√≠a un mes). Se est√° pareciendo mucho a la Seguridad Social en este sentido. Uno paga adicional para poder ser atendido m√°s pronto.
-  La Unidad Dental ya no atiende con Mutuas

The only negative I remember was that when performing the dental CT they ask you to go to an area first and wait until the warning. And it is a very small room with a stool to put things (not to sit) that looks like a size changing room, even smaller in size. And they say you keep doors closed while you wait. I had to wait like this for about 25 minutes! Which I found very very strange. Good thing I'm not claustrophobic, although I didn't feel comfortable either. Nor did they explain the reasons for waiting there and so long. It seemed that the X-ray girls had a lot of trouble and few hands and that's why they put you there to not rush any more. In 10-15 minutes the light went out in this place and it started to scare me a little and I went outside but they asked me to wait longer and they turned on the light. Little nice. But hey, it was a weird episode, it seems exceptional, because apart from this everything is ok.

The criticism that I can comment on was my experience with the dental CT that I had to do for the maxillofacial institute that is located in the territory of the hospital. They have told me to come X day and about 15 minutes before since it will be ready and it will only be to collect. I came to pick him up half an hour before my surgery, and at the reception they told me that they can't find him anywhere but they are looking for him. They took a long time, in the end I had to wait for it to be recorded on disk, and I was late for my surgery. But finally nothing happens, the important thing is that they have solved it and they have apologized, and it is what differentiates good service from bad because we all submit errors. It is only a proposal for my improvement for the center.

We were also with my boyfriend in the visit of Dra. Ana otorhinolaryngologist. He has chronic tonsillitis and pharyngitis. The Dr. gave us a complete diagnosis in the first visit and gave a treatment that has greatly alleviated her symptoms. It was also noticeable that they were not trying to sell extra things, since we have asked him about some treatments that we have seen on the internet and he explained very well which would be effective and which are wasted time and money in his case. Also, to keep track of it, he gave us his contact information and solved all doubts and gave us extra advice through personal contact, without having to go or call the clinic.

And finally, the maxillofacial institute, which was a marvel of the treatment and surgery they have done to me (removing two lower judgment teeth at the same time that they were in an unfavorable position for extraction) was spectacular, I have recovered sooner than expected without any discomfort, and I don't think it is so much my body and its power to recover, but rather the professionalism of the surgeon and his team, since the complete surgery took at most half an hour, Dr. Alejandro Mazarro has been very attentive and together with his assistant Marta Cant√≥n they have calmed me down a lot and have given very good advice. And another very good and relieving part is that they have provided me with all the documents and requests so that my private insurance that was not even dental (medifiatc) would cover it. Very very happy.

It is quite far from the center, since we live outside of Barcelona, ‚Äã‚Äãbut due to the experience and professionalism of the doctors I will definitely return when I need a specialty. It is worth it because you know that you will receive professional treatment, apart from enjoying the modern facilities, which is also important to me.

A family member has been admitted to this hospital after giving birth. The service by the midwife was spectacular, always very attentive. And the treatment during childbirth was good. The views are beautiful, but otherwise we are very unhappy.

At 48h of birth both my relative and his daughter had to be discharged. In the morning when the visit happened, the gynecologist gave her the option of discharging in the morning not yet having passed 48h and re-doing the heel test the next day, but we prefer to wait at the stipulated time. In the afternoon, after performing the heel test, we ask when they would discharge us and through a nurse they inform us that the doctor will not go through the plant again and will not deliver her until the next day, Without indicating the reason. We ask to speak with a doctor to explain the reason and the doctor again through a patient tells us that she refuses to visit the patient. And they tell us from nursing that if we want to leave we must be signing a voluntary discharge and that they will not give us any report or therapeutic recommendations.

On the other hand that same day when the pediatrician came to visit the newborn in the morning, he did not perform a physical examination because he was breastfeeding, indicating that it would happen again later. When they took the newborn to perform the first bath, when bringing it back, we asked when the pediatrician will go back and tell us that he has explored it in the nest room after the bath and that everything was fine. The pediatrician never came to inform the mother about the state of the physical examination. And given the sum of events, we now have doubts that it was really explored.

A lot of facade, all very beautiful, but the human treatment is certainly not the strong point and the feeling with which we stay is that they were interested in billing one more night of admission or the doctors who work in this hospital do not really want to work and let it be the next doctor who goes on duty the next day who makes the discharge.

content:
(Translated by Google) A very bad experience with a woman who works in the admission for X-ray studies and in my case, a breast ultrasound.

I had a request for a breast ultrasound from 07-30-2020, I had gone 2 times to request the appointment, and they told me I was on the waiting list. For 3 months I was waiting to do the study until on 10-29-2020 I went to the Hospital for an appointment that I requested via the internet for another study (mammogram) because there is no option on the web to request an ultrasound, when I went there They wanted to take care of me, besides that I lost the study order flyer that the doctor gave me 3 months ago. I told them that my breasts hurt and that I have waited a long time to do this study, that I am a patient of Quiron Salud and that my data and the order are in my profile with the report of the Doctor who is from the same hospital and that my insurance is Adeslas. They didn't do the study, I still had pain, they told me to leave. Then a woman from the hospital called me telling me that the next day they were going to carry out the study at 4pm on 10-30-2020, when I went, a woman was at the admission desk and I told her that I felt pain in my breasts, I had an appointment and that my flyer had lost it, I told him to please look for it in my patient profile and he did not want to give me support, he told me to leave, he had a very bad, very hostile attitude that made me cry, She told me that she was not going to do the study and that if I did not have the flyer to ask for another appointment so that the doctor could give me a new one and that she does not care that I have pain, that before me there was a long list and that I I was going to stay for January 2021. In spite of all my discomfort and humiliation on the part of that woman, I felt terrible, I had to go to the 4th floor, crying, asking for help from the admission girls that they would please give me my report and the flyer of Adeslas to be able to do the study, they gave them to me and when I went down I finally did They went to the study. In addition to that, I asked for a complaint sheet and the person in charge of that matter would not let me file my complaint and changed the sheet for another. I really feel very disappointed and mistreated by the staff at the center. It is a violation of my rights. That woman who did not want to provide support, does not know how to care for patients should not be working there, she should be sent to a course to learn, she behaved very insolent and indolent, disrespectful, with a very offensive facial expression. In addition, the Hospital appointment system is very bad, as it is possible that people have to wait 3 months to carry out a study, in the middle of October that doctors and staff are supposed to work in the fight against breast cancer. Quir√≥n Salud spends its time in its marketing of prevention and early detection, but early of what? If the appointment system and that person who treated me very badly, they are a mockery and a contradiction to their supposed values ‚Äã‚Äãand marketing! This has happened in Quiron Salud Campo de Gibraltar. 10-30-2020

(Original)
Una muy mala experiencia con una mujer que trabaja en la admisi√≥n para estudios de RX y en el que era mi caso, una ecograf√≠a mamaria.

Ten√≠a una solicitud de ecograf√≠a mamaria desde el 30-07-2020, hab√≠a ido 2 veces para solicitar la cita, y me dec√≠an que estaba en lista de espera. Durante 3 meses estuve esperando para hacer el estudio hasta que el d√≠a 29-10-2020 fui al Hospital por medio de una cita que solicit√© v√≠a internet para otro estudio (mamograf√≠a) porque no hay opci√≥n en la web para solicitar ecograf√≠a, cuando fui no me quisieron atender, adem√°s que se me perdi√≥ el volante de orden de estudio que me dio el m√©dico hace 3 meses. Les dije que me dol√≠an los senos y que he esperado mucho tiempo para hacer ese estudio, que soy paciente del Quiron Salud y que mis datos y la orden est√°n en mi perfil con el informe del Doctor que es del mismo hospital y que mi seguro es Adeslas. No me hicieron el estudio, a√∫n presentado dolor, me dijeron que me fuera. Luego me llam√≥ una mujer del hospital dici√©ndome que al d√≠a siguiente me iban a realizar el estudio a las 4pm del d√≠a 30-10-2020, cuando voy, estaba una mujer en el mostrador de admisi√≥n y le comuniqu√© que sent√≠a dolor en los senos, que ten√≠a una cita y que mi volante lo hab√≠a perdido, le dije que por favor lo buscara en mi perfil del paciente y no me quiso prestar el apoyo, me dijo que me fuera, ten√≠a una muy mala actitud muy hostil que me hizo llorar, me dijo que ella no me iba a hacer el estudio y que si no ten√≠a el volante que pidiera otra cita para que el doctor me diera uno nuevo y que no le importa que tenga dolor, que antes de mi estaba una lista larga y que yo iba a quedar para enero 2021. Dentro de todo mi malestar y humillaci√≥n por parte de esa mujer, me sent√≠ fatal, tuve que ir al piso 4, llorando, pidiendo ayuda a las muchachas de admisi√≥n que por favor me dieran mi informe y el volante de Adeslas para poder hacerme el estudio, me los dieron y cuando baj√© finalmente me hicieron el estudio. Adem√°s de eso ped√≠ una hoja de reclamaciones y la encargada en esa materia no me dejaba poner mi denuncia y me cambi√≥ la hoja por otra. De verdad que me siento muy decepcionada y maltratada por el personal del centro. Es una violaci√≥n a mis derechos. Esa mujer que no quiso prestar el apoyo, no sabe atender a pacientes no deber√≠a estar trabajando all√≠, deber√≠a ser enviada a un curso para que aprenda, se comport√≥ muy insolente e indolente, falta de respeto, con una expresi√≥n facial muy ofensiva. Adem√°s que el sistema de citas del Hospital es muy malo, como es posible que la gente tenga que esperar 3 meses para realizar un estudio, en pleno mes de Octubre que se supone que los m√©dicos y el personal, tienen que trabajar en la lucha contra el c√°ncer de mama. Quir√≥n Salud se la pasa en su marketing de la prevenci√≥n y detecci√≥n temprana, pero temprana de qu√©? Si el sistema de cita y esa persona que me atendi√≥ muy mal, son una burla y una contradicci√≥n a sus supuestos valores y marketing!! Esto ha ocurrido en Quiron Salud Campo de Gibraltar. 30-10-2020

(Translated by Google) I want to comment on the experience of my aunt Charo, after a 6-month journey of going to the Emergency Department at Hospital Punta Europa and her family doctor.
Her doctor always attended her by phone, in the ER they were only limited to giving her painkillers ...

Until we look for the best Urologist in C√°diz, but I would say one of the best in Spain.
Dr. Jos√© Manuel Fern√°ndez Montero, head of Urology at the Quiron Hospital in Palmones.
He saw her at the end of September, with great affection and professionalism he not only knew what she had.
He sent her a test and a treatment that is curing my aunt from the terrible pain she was suffering.
But what I want to thank you the most is, that you have given him the will to live and hope.
This doctor has not only cured his illness, he has also cured his soul ...
My aunt has changed, she is more vital and cheerful, we owe that to you and there is no money to pay it ...
Don Jos√© Manuel Fern√°ndez Montero, thank you very much ...

Direcci√≥n: Avenida De Los Empresarios Edificio Arttysur
content:
(Translated by Google) Last week my wife had an operation for advanced peritonitis. I have to congratulate the doctor who operated on her and the entire nursing team who have treated her for her professionalism and excellent treatment. However, every story has a B side.
We arrived at the emergency room at 2.30 in the morning on Wednesday, July 15 because my wife had excruciating abdominal pain, so much so that we had to use one of the hospital wheelchairs. There was absolutely nobody, that is to say, without saturation of patients. The doctor on duty took care of her after about 15 minutes since my wife left the triage (the man would be very involved ...). He did a blood test and felt his fully inflamed abdomen, checking that the pain worsened as he released the pressure of his hands on it. I performed a urine and blood test and concluded that my wife had a urine infection! My wife did not present any symptoms typical of this condition, neither itching when urinating, nor the need to urinate. With that diagnosis and with excruciating pain, he sent us back home with the prescription for an antibiotic for a urine infection. 19 hours later my wife not only did not improve but she vomited in pain and did not even have the strength to speak. All day in bed without being able to move. I decided to take her back to the emergency room without completing the 48 hours of the antibiotic treatment for urine infection and this time yes, the doctor on call (professional and quick in her performance) repeated the analyzes based on the obvious symptoms she had. my wife and did a CT scan that revealed the severity and progress of the peritonitis that could have cost my wife's life. I think an appendicitis is something that is studied in medical preschool, but the man who attended my wife the first night probably skipped that class or was too sleepy to devote the attention he deserved due to the severity of the symptoms. I will be happy to provide you with all the details of the doctor who treated my wife as well as the medical reports because I think that in any hospital worth their salt they should make sure that absolutely ALL staff are qualified and up to scratch. This cannot be allowed in a hospital and less in this category.

(Original)
La semana pasada operaron a mi mujer de una peritonitis avanzada. Tengo que felicitar a la doctora que la oper√≥ y a todo el equipo de enfermer√≠a que la han atendido por su profesionalidad y excelente trato. Sin embargo, toda historia tiene una cara B.
Llegamos a urgencias a las 2.30 de la madrugada del mi√©rcoles 15 de Julio porque mi mujer presentaba dolor abdominal insoportable, tanto que tuvimos que usar una de las sillas de ruedas del hospital. No hab√≠a absolutamente nadie, es decir, sin saturaci√≥n de pacientes. El m√©dico de guardia la atendi√≥ al cabo de unos 15 minutos desde que mi mujer sali√≥ de triaje (estaria muy liado el hombre...) . Le hizo un an√°lisis de sangre y palp√≥ su abdomen completamente inflamado comprobando que el dolor se agudizaba al liberar la presi√≥n de sus manos sobre el mismo. Le realizo una anal√≠tica de orina y otra de sangre y concluy√≥ que mi mujer tenia una infecci√≥n de orina!. Mi mujer no presentaba ningun s√≠ntoma propio de esa afecci√≥n, ni escozor al orinar, ni necesidad de orinar. Con ese diagnostico y con un dolor insoportable nos mand√≥ de vuelta a casa con la receta de antibi√≥tico para infecci√≥n de orina. 19 horas mas tarde mi mujer no solo no mejor√≥ sino que vomit√≥ de dolor y no ten√≠a fuerzas ni para hablar. Todo el dia en la cama sin poder moverse. Decid√≠ llevarla de nuevo a urgencias sin completar las 48 horas que dura el tratamiento antibiotico para la infecci√≥n de orina y esta vez si, la doctora de guardia (profesional y r√°pida en su actuaci√≥n) le repiti√≥ los analisis en base a los s√≠ntomas evidentes que presentaba mi mujer y le hizo un TAC que revel√≥ la gravedad y lo avanzado de la peritonitis que pudo haberle costado la vida a mi mujer. Creo que una apendicitis es algo que se estudia en preescolar de medicina pero el se√±or que atendi√≥ a mi mujer la primera noche seguramente se salt√≥ esa clase o ten√≠a demasiado sue√±o como para dedicarle la atenci√≥n que merec√≠a por la gravedad de los s√≠ntomas. Estar√© encantado de facilitarles todos los detalles del doctor que atendi√≥ a mi mujer as√≠ como los informes m√©dicos porque creo que en cualquier hospital que se precie deber√≠an asegurarse de que absolutamente TODO el personal est√° cualificado y a la altura. Esto no se puede permitir en un hospital y menos de esta categor√≠a.

This morning I was at the Quir√≥n de Juan Bravo 39 hospital to undergo a surgical intervention called arthroscopy of the temporo mandibular joint, I had the operation scheduled for exactly one month, at the medical visit in which the operation was scheduled, the surgeon He spoke to me and explained that there was a part of the surgical intervention that I would have to pay out of my own pocket, that ASISA did not cover, and that the budget would reach me by email provided by myself, which is marimarcorraltoral7@gmail.com Well, that budget never came to me, I received calls to present myself in the preoperative period, for the visit with the anesthetist and to tell me what time I had to present myself today, July 31, 2020 at seven-thirty in the morning, so I have done it, and the lady and / or young lady of admission presents me with a document asking for 1750 euros that I have to pay at the moment if I want to have surgery, without giving me time to assess my situation economic action and without offering me at least one manager to explain anything to me, I have felt treated like garbage for the first time in my life, in addition to having been given a room, 416, without water to wash myself or toilet paper, they have operated on me and in the afternoon I went home crying with helplessness, helplessness and frustration.
